Package rpgonline.abt Description

A system of hierarchical tags used to store data in a binary form.

Although an ABT file has the file extension .abt this isn't needed and the library will parse any stream which starts with a valid header.

Strings in this library are stored in UTF-8 format with an integer value preceding them to store the length (in bytes) of the string. When storing data is best to keep the length under the size of a signed integer of the specified size as some systems don't support unsigned integers over a certain size. For the rest of this documentation string sizes will be denoted as "nbit string".

File Structure Definitions
This section includes definitions for the structure of an ABT file. When in a list these must be kept in the order shown (unless stated).

ABT Document:

  • Header
  • TagGroup
The first tag group acts as the root of the document and holds all tags within it. The name of this tag does not matter but should usually be "root".

Header:

  • 4 byte header: 0x41425431
  • Version: 16bit signed int
  • Application ID: 8bit string

Tag:

  • Tag type ID: 8bit integer
  • Tag name: 16bit string
  • Tag data: various formats
Note: the tag with ID 0x0 is special and marks the end of a tag group. It only has an ID and has no name or data and is 1 byte in length.

Tag Data Formats

Tag ID (Hex) Name Java Class Storage format Used to store Notes
0x00 null N/A N/A N/A This tag only has an ID and is not converted to an object when read.
0x01 group TagGroup
  • Size: 64bit unsigned integer
  • Tags...
  • Null terminator
 List/Array This tag hold other tags but does not have to maintain the same order. To store ordered data, the names of the contained tags should be indexes.
0x02 byte TagByte
  • Value: 8bit integer
 byte
0x03 short TagShort
  • Value: 16bit integer
 short
0x04 int TagInt
  • Value: 32bit integer
 int
0x05 long TagLong
  • Value: 64bit integer
 long
0x08 float TagFloat
  • Value: 32bit float
 float
0x09 double TagDouble
  • Value: 64bit float
 double
0x0B string16 TagStringShort
  • Value: 16bit string
 String
0x0C string TagString
  • Value: 64bit string
 String
0x18 char TagChar
  • Value: 16bit integer
 char
0x20 bool TagBoolean
  • Value: byte (1 = true, 0 = false).
 boolean

Tag values of 0x06, 0x07, 0x0D, 0x0E, 0x0F, 0x10, 0x11, 0x12, 0x13, 0x14, 0x15, 0x16, 0x17, 0x19, 0x1A, 0x1B, 0x1C, 0x1D, 0x1E and 0x1F are deprecated (as of version 1) and were not included in this table many of these types were array types and should be replaced with groups. The other types were big data types and should be strings or groups.

Tomas
